meanings.definition: Of the same age or date; contemporary.
meanings.sent1: The two friends were coaeval, having been born on the same day.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins and the artifacts found nearby were coaeval.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog and a cat detective being coaeval in a story made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The music of the 80s and the fashion trends of that time are coaeval in our memories.
meanings.sent5: The twins' coaeval appearance often led people to mistake them for each other.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of the same age or date; a contemporary.
meanings.sent1: She considered her coaeval in the office as her closest friend.
meanings.sent2: The artist's coaeval, who shared the same mentor, was also gaining recognition.
meanings.sent3: The two rival magicians, both coaevals in skill, constantly tried to outdo each other.
meanings.sent4: The two trees, coaevals in the forest, stood tall and proud together.
meanings.sent5: The coaeval of the famous author, though less known, had a unique style of writing.
